column2: soaking up all the amazing advice here
column3: and now I'm finally taking the plunge into automatic investing. My current strategy is... well
column4: it's pretty much non-existent beyond squirreling away some cash irregularly when I remember. I've realized that if I want to get serious about building wealth
column5: I need to automate this whole process. The idea of ""set it and forget it"" really appeals to me – I figure if the money's gone before I even see it
column6: I'm less likely to spend it on impulse buys.

column1: I've been doing some digging and it seems like most platforms offer some form of recurring investments
column2: whether it's through direct deposit splits or scheduled transfers to a brokerage account
column3: and then further automation to buy specific ETFs or mutual funds. I'm mainly looking at setting up something consistent for my Roth IRA and possibly a taxable brokerage account down the line. I've seen terms like Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA) thrown around
column4: which makes total sense to me – smoothing out the market's ups and downs by buying regularly. My main goal is to be consistently putting money to work without having to manually initiate a transfer and then place a trade every single time. It feels like there's a good way to streamline this that I'm just not quite grasping yet.
